definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
single girl who is not interested in relationships, living a lackadaisical life (loanword from Japanese "himono onna")
derivation of a Chinese loanword from Japanese by using the same characters (or variants) but applying Chinese pronunciation (e.g. 場合|场合[chang3 he2], derived from Japanese 場合, pronounced "ba'ai")
"a slave to certificates", sb who does one's utmost to obtain as many certificates as possible so to be more employable
double income family who have pets rather than children (see also 丁克[ding1 ke4])
initial/first letter of word (in Latin script)
